Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, I need to understand the structure of the BPMN diagram. It starts with a Market Research task, followed by R&D for designing a prototype. Then, there are parallel gateways for securing components from different regions, which are split into four tasks.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After that, components are shipped to an assembly plant where smartphones are assembled continuously. There's an Exclusive Gateway for quality checks, leading to either packing or rework/scrap.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Quality passes go through air freight and other shipping, then customs, regional distribution, inventory monitoring, and finally decision-making on orders and the next sales cycle.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I should think about each of these stages and identify key areas where deeper questioning would be beneficial. For each area—rationale, improvements, risks, etc.—I'll brainstorm questions that push the user to think beyond the surface details.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Starting with rationale, why each task is necessary. For improvements, how can processes be optimized. Risks might involve delays or supply chain disruptions.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Decision-making could involve trade-offs between cost and quality. Communication is crucial across different regions and departments.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Performance measurement would involve KPIs and how to evaluate success.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: I'll need to ensure each question is open-ended, allowing for detailed responses. They should cover all the parts of the process, from the initial research to the final decisions.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: I'll also make sure to vary the questions to cover different aspects without repeating the same topic.
